column.name: AlertType
column.summary: Enum:AlertType Identifies what types of alert this row is assocaited to.

Enumeration.name: AlertType
Enumeration.EnumValue: 35 - Alert if an account using 10DLC goes over their daily max limit or if we've neglected to set up our pref correctly

column.name: Type
column.summary: Enum:AlertType Identifies what type of alert this row is.

Enumeration.name: AlertType
Enumeration.EnumValue: 35 - Alert if an account using 10DLC goes over their daily max limit or if we've neglected to set up our pref correctly

column.name: ApiSubscriptionNum
column.summary: Primary key.

column.name: EndPointUrl
column.summary: This is the URL endpoint to which events will be sent.

column.name: Workstation
column.summary: Name of the workstation that will fire events. Blank if you want all workstations to fire events.

column.name: CustomerKey
column.summary: API Key the subscribing developer gave the customer. There can be multiple 3rd parties products for one database, each with their own key.

column.name: WatchTable
column.summary: Enum: EnumWatchTable, stored as string

column.name: PollingSeconds
column.summary: Frequency of database polling, in seconds.

column.name: UiEventType
column.summary: Enum: EnumApiUiEventType, stored as string.

column.name: DateTimeStart
column.summary: When the subscription started. This gets updated each time db is polled so that it represents the start of the date range for the next polling.

column.name: DateTimeStop
column.summary: When the subscription will expire. MinVal 01-01-0001 if no expiration.

column.name: IsMobile
column.summary: Bool indicating if this ApptViewItem is for use in Mobile App appointment view

column.name: ProcessingStatus
column.summary: Enum:CareCreditWebStatus Used to determine if the request is pending, needs action, or is completed.

Enumeration.name: CareCreditWebStatus
Enumeration.EnumValue: 17. This is manually created when we get the merchant number to create process BQS.

column.name: CommBridge
column.summary: Enum:EclaimsCommBridge One of the included hard-coded communications briges. Or none to just create the claim files without uploading.

Enumeration.name: EclaimsCommBridge
Enumeration.summary: Each clearinghouse can have a hard-coded comm bridge which handles all the communications of transfering the claim files to the clearinghouse/carrier. Does not just include X12, but can include any format at all.

column.name: LinkType
column.summary: Enum:DefLinkType The type of link.

Enumeration.name: DefLinkType
Enumeration.summary: The manner in which a definition is linked.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 5. The definition is linked to a recall type.

column.name: PrefillStatusOverride
column.summary: Holds the previous revision number that marks what sheet def revision number we expect to have a submission for from the patient. This value can be incremented when changes are made to a linked sheet definition, but it is not always updated. This should hold the last revision number that was updated for this eClipboardSheetDef. If a patient has a Sheet filled out that has a revision ID that matches this or is greater (this field will be 0 by default, or they filled out a more up to date form manually in the office and not through eClipboard), then this form will be filtered out if set to PrefillStatuses.Once when we determine which forms load for the patient in eClipboard. If this value is higher than the RevID of the last sheet the patient filled out, we consider this eClipboardSheetDef to be updated and the patient will need to fill out the form again when set to PrefillStatuses.Once.

column.name: QueryString
column.summary: Allows gmail users to specify search parameters

column.name: EServiceAction
column.summary: Enum:eServiceAction

Enumeration.name: eServiceAction
Enumeration.EnumValue: 35 - Patient Portal, Patient Notified of Possible Duplicate Payment.
36 - Patient Portal, Patient Allowed Submission of Duplicate Payment.
37 - Patient Portal, Patient Rejected Submission of Duplicate Payment.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:Permissions Some permissions will treat a zero FKey differently. Some denote it as having access to everything for that PermType. I.e. Reports.

Enumeration.name: Permissions
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 225 - Logs when API subscriptions are added or deleted. For audit trails only.

column.name: ExcludeOtherCoverageOnPriClaims
column.summary: If set to true, and the patient's secondary inurance plan uses this insfilingcode, the secondary insurance plan will not be populated on primary e-claims or paper claims.

column.name: DefaultCat
column.summary: FK to definition.DefNum. If set, a new mount will go into this category, regardless of which category is currently selected.

column.name: PermType
column.summary: Enum:Permissions

Enumeration.name: Permissions
Enumeration.summary: A hard-coded list of permissions which may be granted to usergroups.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 225 - Logs when API subscriptions are added or deleted. For audit trails only.

column.name: FKeyType
column.summary: Enum:KeyType Describes the type of object referenced by the FKey.

Enumeration.name: KeyType
Enumeration.summary: Do not combine with SignalType, they must be seperate. Stored as string, safe to reorder enum values.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 13 - Used to indicate that this specific email address is what this signal is for

column.name: IType
column.summary: Enum:InvalidType Indicates what cache or entity has been changed.

Enumeration.name: InvalidType
Enumeration.summary: When the autorefresh message is sent to the other computers, this is the type.
Enumeration.EnumValue: 106. Table in db is apisubscriptions. Small and changes rarely, but all workstations must know about the change.
